org.osate.reporter

Class ReporterSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.osate.reporter.ReporterSettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ReporterSettings
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Each instance of this class contains user preferences as to how the report generator should group, sort, and filter markers. It also specifies what should be displayed in the summary. Objects of this class are instanciated by an int array, a boolean array, and a HashSet of Strings.

    The int array should consist of 6 elements specifying the grouping and sorting prefferences. When filling the array use the constants GROUP_BY_FIELD, SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD, SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST, SORT_MARKERS_BY_SECOND, SORT_MARKERS_BY_THIRD, and SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH to specify the cell of the array and set it with one of the constants DEFAULT, GROUP_BY_FILE, GROUP_BY_TYPE, SORT_BY_SEVERITY, SORT_BY_MESSAGE, SORT_BY_LOCATION, SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE, SORT_BY_FILE_NAME, SORT_BY_FILE_TYPE.

    The boolean array should consist of 7 elements specifying what should be shown in the summary. When filling the array use the constants SHOW_SEVERITY_FIELD, SHOW_NUM_OF_TEXT_AND_OBJECT_FILES, SHOW_NUM_OF_FILES, SHOW_NUM_OF_TYPES, SHOW_NUM_OF_MARKERS_PER_FILES, SHOW_NUM_OF_MARKERS_PER_TYPE, and SHOW_TOTAL_NUM_OF_MARKERS to specify the cell of the array and set it with true or false depending on whether you want to show the specific element in the summary. The HashSet should contain all the problem marker types that are to be excluded from the report. The marker types are to be specified by their unique identifier. For example: to exclude the Java Problem Marker, include in the set the String "org.eclipse.jdt.core.marker". To display all marker types in the report, pass null to the constructor instead of a HashSet.

    The class is Serializable so that it can be saved to disk by ReporterSettingsFrame and read by Reporter.

    Author:
    Joe Seibel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT
      Unspecified grouping or no sorting.
      static int GROUP_BY_FIELD
      Specifies the cell in the int array that controls whether markers are to be grouped by file or marker type.
      static int GROUP_BY_FILE
      Specifies to group each marker by the file it is from.
      static int GROUP_BY_TYPE
      Specifies to group each marker by its marker type.
      static int SHOW_NUM_OF_FILES
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the total number of files.
      static int SHOW_NUM_OF_MARKERS_PER_FILES
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the number of markers for each individual file.
      static int SHOW_NUM_OF_MARKERS_PER_TYPE
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the number of markers for each marker type.
      static int SHOW_NUM_OF_TEXT_AND_OBJECT_FILES
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the total number of aadl files and the total number of aaxl files.
      static int SHOW_NUM_OF_TYPES
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the total number of marker types.
      static int SHOW_SEVERITY_FIELD
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the total number of errors, warinings, and info.
      static int SHOW_TOTAL_NUM_OF_MARKERS
      Specifies the cell in the boolean array that controls whether or not to display the total number of markers in the report.
      static int SORT_BY_FILE_NAME
      Specifies to sort the groups of markers or the markers in each group by the file that the marker is assosiated with.
      static int SORT_BY_FILE_TYPE
      Specifies to sort the groups of markers by file type(.aadl or .aaxl).
      static int SORT_BY_LOCATION
      Specifies to sort the markers in each group by location.
      static int SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE
      Specifies to sort the markers in each group by marker type.
      static int SORT_BY_MESSAGE
      Specifies to sort the markers in each group by message.
      static int SORT_BY_SEVERITY
      Specifies to sort the markers in each group by severity.
      static int SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD
      Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how groups are to be sorted.
      static int SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST
      Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted.

      Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted.

      Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted.
      static int SORT_MARKERS_BY_THIRD
      Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT

        public static final int DEFAULT
        Unspecified grouping or no sorting. Used as a value for any of the cells in the int array. The default for GROUP_BY_FIELD is GROUP_BY_FILES.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GROUP_BY_FILE

        public static final int GROUP_BY_FILE
        Specifies to group each marker by the file it is from. Used as a value for the GROUP_BY_FIELD cell in the int array.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GROUP_BY_TYPE

        public static final int GROUP_BY_TYPE
        Specifies to group each marker by its marker type. Used as a value for the GROUP_BY_FIELD cell in the int array.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_BY_SEVERITY

        public static final int SORT_BY_SEVERITY
        Specifies to sort the markers in each group by severity. Used as a value for SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST through SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH cells in the int array.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_BY_MESSAGE

        public static final int SORT_BY_MESSAGE
        Specifies to sort the markers in each group by message. Used as a value for SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST through SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH cells in the int array.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_BY_LOCATION

        public static final int SORT_BY_LOCATION
        Specifies to sort the markers in each group by location. Used as a value for SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST through SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH cells in the int array.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE

        public static final int SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE
        Specifies to sort the markers in each group by marker type. Used as a value for SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST through SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH cell in the int array. This value should only be used when grouping markers by file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_BY_FILE_NAME

        public static final int SORT_BY_FILE_NAME
        Specifies to sort the groups of markers or the markers in each group by the file that the marker is assosiated with. Used as a value for SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD when grouping by file. Also used as a value for SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST through SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH when grouping by marker type.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_BY_FILE_TYPE

        public static final int SORT_BY_FILE_TYPE
        Specifies to sort the groups of markers by file type(.aadl or .aaxl). Used as a value for SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD when grouping by file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GROUP_BY_FIELD

        public static final int GROUP_BY_FIELD
        Specifies the cell in the int array that controls whether markers are to be grouped by file or marker type. Set this cell with GROUP_BY_FILE or GROUP_BY_TYPE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD

        public static final int SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD
        Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how groups are to be sorted. When grouping by file, use SORT_BY_FILE_NAME or SORT_BY_FILE_TYPE. When grouping by marker type, the value of this cell has no affect.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST

        public static final int SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST
        Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted. Set this cell with DEFAULT, SORT_BY_SEVERITY, SORT_BY_MESSAGE, and SORT_BY_LOCATION. When grouping by file, SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE can be used and when grouping by marker type, SORT_BY_FILE_NAME can be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_MARKERS_BY_SECOND

        public static final int SORT_MARKERS_BY_SECOND
        Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted. Set this cell with DEFAULT, SORT_BY_SEVERITY, SORT_BY_MESSAGE, and SORT_BY_LOCATION. When grouping by file, SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE can be used and when grouping by marker type, SORT_BY_FILE_NAME can be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_MARKERS_BY_THIRD

        public static final int SORT_MARKERS_BY_THIRD
        Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted. Set this cell with DEFAULT, SORT_BY_SEVERITY, SORT_BY_MESSAGE, and SORT_BY_LOCATION. When grouping by file, SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE can be used and when grouping by marker type, SORT_BY_FILE_NAME can be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH

        public static final int SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH
        Specifies the cell in the int array that controls how markers are to be sorted. Set this cell with DEFAULT, SORT_BY_SEVERITY, SORT_BY_MESSAGE, and SORT_BY_LOCATION. When grouping by file, SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE can be used and when grouping by marker type, SORT_BY_FILE_NAME can be used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReporterSettings

        public ReporterSettings()
        Creates a new ReporterSettings object with the default settings.

      • ReporterSettings

        public ReporterSettings(int[] groupByAndSortBy,
                boolean[] showInSummary,
                java.util.HashSet problemMarkersToExclude)
        Creates a new ReporterSettings object with custom settings specified by the two arrays and the HashSet.
        Parameters:
        groupByAndSortBy - 6 elements specifying how the markers should be grouped by, how the groups should be sorted, and how the markers should be sorted.
        showInSummary - 7 elements specifying what should be shown in the report's summary.
        problemMarkersToExclude - Set of Strings. Unique identifiers of the problem markers to exclude in the report. For example: to exclude the Java Problem, include the String "org.eclipse.jdt.core.problem" in the set. To include all problem markers in the report, pass null to this constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getGroupByAndSortBy

        public int getGroupByAndSortBy(int field)
        Gets the grouping or sorting setting for the field specified.
        Parameters:
        field - Specifies the element in the int array. Use GROUP_BY_FIELD, SORT_GROUPS_BY_FIELD, SORT_MARKERS_BY_FIRST, SORT_MARKERS_BY_SECOND, SORT_MARKERS_BY_THIRD, or SORT_MARKERS_BY_FOURTH.
        Returns:
        The grouping or sorting settings specified by the field. The value returned will be DEFAULT, GROUP_BY_FILE, GROUP_BY_TYPE, SORT_BY_SEVERITY, SORT_BY_MESSAGE, SORT_BY_LOCATION, SORT_BY_MARKER_TYPE, SORT_BY_FILE_NAME, or SORT_BY_FILE_TYPE.

      • getShowInSummary

        public boolean getShowInSummary(int field)
        Gets the summary setting for the field specified.
        Parameters:
        field - Specifies the element in the boolean array. Use SHOW_SEVERITY_FIELD, SHOW_NUM_OF_TEXT_AND_OBJECT_FILES, SHOW_NUM_OF_FILES, SHOW_NUM_OF_TYPES, SHOW_NUM_OF_MARKERS_PER_FILES, SHOW_NUM_OF_MARKERS_PER_TYPE, or SHOW_TOTAL_NUM_OF_MARKERS.
        Returns:
        true if the specified field is to be shown in the summary.

      • showSummary

        public boolean showSummary()
        Determines whether or not to show a summary by searching for true elements in the boolean array.
        Returns:
        true is a summary to be shown.

      • getProblemMarkersToExclude

        public java.util.HashSet getProblemMarkersToExclude()
        Gets all the unique identifiers of problem markers to exclude from the report. If null is returned, all problem markers are to be displayed.
        Returns:
        HashSet of Strings of unique identifiers.
